model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: Exactly as described, no qualms. It was released a while back, but SSD technology has really only increased read/write speeds and hasn't focused much on other features like density, power, lifespan, etc. Decent speed and large capacity for a decent price, no complaining here. Won't have to worry about storage for a couple of years unless game file size keeps inflating or I become a professional in need of storage space.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I recently decided to upgrade my computer's storage, and after some research, I went for the Samsung 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe. It seemed the most cost-effective and would hold up over time. The Samsung 970 EVO Plus 2TB SSD has significantly improved my computing experience. The combination of speed and ample storage is a real game-changer, even if it does come with a higher price tag. If you're looking to level up your storage game, this SSD is definitely worth considering.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: This Samsung 970 EVO Plus NVMe 2TB drive is phenomenal. It replaced a 500gb SATA SSD and the difference is night and day: Windows starts in seconds, applications load almost instantly, and there’s tons of space. Cyber Monday pricing at Best Buy made this purchase a no brainer. Highly recommended if your system is limited to PCIe Gen 3.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: Exactly as described, no qualms. It was released a while back, but SSD technology has really only increased read/write speeds and hasn't focused much on other features like density, power, lifespan, etc. Decent speed and large capacity for a decent price, no complaining here. Won't have to worry about storage for a couple of years unless game file size keeps inflating or I become a professional in need of storage space.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I recently decided to upgrade my computer's storage, and after some research, I went for the Samsung 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe. The combination of speed and ample storage is a real game-changer, even if it does come with a higher price tag. If you're looking to level up your storage game, this SSD is definitely worth considering.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

It replaced a 500gb SATA SSD and the difference is night and day: Windows starts in seconds, applications load almost instantly, and there’s tons of space. The combination of speed and ample storage is a real game-changer, even if it does come with a higher price tag. If you're looking to level up your storage game, this SSD is definitely worth considering.

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

Won't have to worry about storage for a couple of years unless game file size keeps inflating or I become a professional in need of storage space.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

review: This Samsung 970 EVO Plus NVMe 2TB drive is phenomenal. It replaced a 500gb SATA SSD and the difference is night and day: Windows starts in seconds, applications load almost instantly, and there’s tons of space. Cyber Monday pricing at Best Buy made this purchase a no brainer. Highly recommended if your system is limited to PCIe Gen 3.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

It replaced a 500gb SATA SSD and the difference is night and day: Windows starts in seconds, applications load almost instantly, and there’s tons of space. Cyber Monday pricing at Best Buy made this purchase a no brainer. Highly recommended if your system is limited to PCIe Gen 3.

review: Exactly as described, no qualms. It was released a while back, but SSD technology has really only increased read/write speeds and hasn't focused much on other features like density, power, lifespan, etc. Decent speed and large capacity for a decent price, no complaining here. Won't have to worry about storage for a couple of years unless game file size keeps inflating or I become a professional in need of storage space.

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

review: I recently decided to upgrade my computer's storage, and after some research, I went for the Samsung 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe. It seemed the most cost-effective and would hold up over time. The Samsung 970 EVO Plus 2TB SSD has significantly improved my computing experience. The combination of speed and ample storage is a real game-changer, even if it does come with a higher price tag. If you're looking to level up your storage game, this SSD is definitely worth considering.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: I have been using this for a couple of weeks now, no complaint. The only thing I noticed is compared with the previous SK Hynix 512G SSD in my Dell G3, the operational temperature is slightly higher, roughly 10C. That's because the former is 2260 and the heat sink is also for that form factor. I am looking for a proper form factor heat sink to reduce the temp a little. The speed in RND4kQ32T16 is x3 times faster.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: Installed in Acer Predator laptop for increased capacity, so far it is working great, easy install.

review: Installed in an MSI machine and loaded it full of games, doesn't even break a sweat.

model: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: This Samsung 970 EVO Plus NVMe 2TB drive is phenomenal. It replaced a 500gb SATA SSD and the difference is night and day: Windows starts in seconds, applications load almost instantly, and there’s tons of space. Cyber Monday pricing at Best Buy made this purchase a no brainer. Highly recommended if your system is limited to PCIe Gen 3.

product: Samsung - 970 EVO Plus 2TB Internal SSD PCIe Gen 3 x4 NVMe
review: Exactly as described, no qualms. It was released a while back, but SSD technology has really only increased read/write speeds and hasn't focused much on other features like density, power, lifespan, etc. Decent speed and large capacity for a decent price, no complaining here. Won't have to worry about storage for a couple of years unless game file size keeps inflating or I become a professional in need of storage space.
